head.title: Airline Group Assails Long Customs Delays

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Manufacturing, Operations and Logistics

hedline.hl1: Airline Group Assails Long Customs Delays

block.p: LEAD: International passengers at 15 airports in the United States routinely waited two hours or more to clear customs this summer, the president of an airline trade association says, calling for action by the Government to correct the problem.

LEAD: International passengers at 15 airports in the United States routinely waited two hours or more to clear customs this summer, the president of an airline trade association says, calling for action by the Government to correct the problem.

International passengers at 15 airports in the United States routinely waited two hours or more to clear customs this summer, the president of an airline trade association says, calling for action by the Government to correct the problem.

In a news conference on Wednesday, Robert Aaronson of the Air Transport Association told of an incident on Sunday in which passengers on a Swissair flight from Zurich had to wait five hours to get out of the terminal at Los Angeles International Airport. While the Swissair passengers were delayed longer than most, such ''inhumane inconveniences'' are becoming more common, said Mr. Aaronson, whose group represents air carriers.
